page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {CHARLES PEACE-MURDERER He was a thief who lived in Greystones and in 1875 he made friends with{Mr. {and Mrs. Dyson.}Peace insulted Mr. Dyson and threatened Mrs. Dyson. He had a gun the husband. Charles ran away to London. In 1878 he was arrested and tried for murder. He was found guilty and{hanged in 1879. {BISHOPS HOUSE} Built in{l490,}it was later owned by 2 Bishops, John and Geoffrey Blythe. It has one of the oldest floors in South Yorkshire. There were no windows so at night owls flew in and dived down and caught the rodents which lived in the straw on the floor. They had a canopy over the bed to keep out owl droppings and draughts.
